The workflow used to achieve this transformation and the individual steps are also captured. Biospecimen (mixin) - A Biospecimen is any natural material taken from a biological entity (usually a human) for testing, diagnostics, treatment, or research purposes. The Biospecimen is linked to the Individual from which the Biospecimen is derived. Cohort (mixin) - A cohort is a collection of individuals that share a common characteristic/observation and have been grouped together for a research study/investigation. DataAccessCommittee (mixin) - A group of members that are delegated to grant access to one or more datasets after ensuring the minimum criteria for data sharing has been met, and request for data use does not raise ethical and/or legal concerns. DataAccessPolicy (mixin) - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. Dataset (mixin) - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution and is tied to a Data Access Policy. Experiment (mixin) - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. Family (mixin) - A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption. File (mixin) - A file is an object that contains information generated from a process, either an Experiment or an Analysis. Individual (mixin) - An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. Project (mixin) - A high level organization for a collection of studies based on a research proposal that aims to achieve certain goals. Sample (mixin) - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). Study (mixin) - Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied.

docs.text: Class: attribute mixin ¶ Mixin for entities that can have one or more attributes. URI: GHGA:AttributeMixin Mixin for ¶ DataAccessCommittee (mixin) - A group of members that are delegated to grant access to one or more datasets after ensuring the minimum criteria for data sharing has been met, and request for data use does not raise ethical and/or legal concerns. DataAccessPolicy (mixin) - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. Dataset (mixin) - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution and is tied to a Data Access Policy. Experiment (mixin) - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. ExperimentProcess (mixin) - An Experiment Process is a process that describes how a Sample is transformed to a File via an assay. The Experiment Process also keeps track of the Protocol used and the Agent that is running the experiment. File (mixin) - A file is an object that contains information generated from a process, either an Experiment or an Analysis. Project (mixin) - A high level organization for a collection of studies based on a research proposal that aims to achieve certain goals. Protocol (mixin) - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Sample (mixin) - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). Study (mixin) - Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied. docs.text: Class: donor ¶ A Donor is an Individual that participates in a research Study by donating a Biospecimen. The use of the Biospecimen is restricted to the consent provided by the Donor. URI: GHGA:Donor Parents ¶ is_a: Individual - An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. Attributes ¶ Inherited from individual: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞xref 0..* Description: Holds one or more database cross references for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String given name 0..1 Description: First name. Range: String in subsets: (restricted) family name 0..1 Description: Last name. Range: String in subsets: (restricted) additional name 0..1 Description: Additional name(s). Range: String in subsets: (restricted) individual➞sex 1..1 Description: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. Range: biological sex enum in subsets: (essential,restricted) karyotype 0..1 Description: The karyotype of an individual if defined. Range: String in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞age 1..1 Description: Age of an individual. Range: age range enum in subsets: (essential,restricted) individual➞vital status 1..1 Description: Last known Vital Status of an Individual. Range: vital status enum in subsets: (essential,restricted) geographical region 0..1 Description: The geographical region where the Individual is located. Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries. Range: String in subsets: (optional,restricted) has ancestry 0..* Description: A person's descent or lineage, from a person or from a population. Typically this is a value from HANCESTRO (Human Ancestry Ontology). Range: Ancestry in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞has parent 0..* Description: One or more parent for this Individual. Range: Individual in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞has children 0..* Description: One or more children for this Individual. Range: Individual in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞has disease 0..* Description: The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. Range: Disease in subsets: (essential,public) individual➞has phenotypic feature 0..* Description: The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. Range: PhenotypicFeature in subsets: (essential,restricted) individual➞has file 0..* Description: Additional/supplementary files associated with an Individual. Typically, a phenopacket or pedigree file. Range: File in subsets: (essential,restricted) individual➞alias 1..1 Description: The alias for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) Other properties ¶ Aliases: participant

docs.text: Class: ega accession mixin ¶ Mixin for entities that can be assigned an EGA accession, in addition to GHGA accession. URI: GHGA:EgaAccessionMixin Mixin for ¶ Analysis (mixin) - An Analysis is a data transformation that transforms input data to output data. The workflow used to achieve this transformation and the individual steps are also captured. DataAccessCommittee (mixin) - A group of members that are delegated to grant access to one or more datasets after ensuring the minimum criteria for data sharing has been met, and request for data use does not raise ethical and/or legal concerns. DataAccessPolicy (mixin) - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. Dataset (mixin) - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution and is tied to a Data Access Policy. Experiment (mixin) - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. File (mixin) - A file is an object that contains information generated from a process, either an Experiment or an Analysis. Individual (mixin) - An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. Sample (mixin) - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). Study (mixin) - Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Own ¶ ega accession 0..1 Description: A unique European Genome-Phenome Archive (EGA) identifier assigned to an entity for the sole purpose of referring to that entity within the EGA federated network. Range: String
docs.title: Class: ega accession mixin

docs.text: Subset: essential ¶ Subset of properties that are considered to be essential for the functionality of GHGA. URI: GHGA:essential Classes ¶ Mixins ¶ Slots ¶ affiliation - The Institution(s) associated with an entity. age - Age of an individual. alias - The alias for an entity. analysis process➞has input - The input data File entities used in the Analysis Process. analysis➞alias - An alias uniquely identifying this Analysis entitiy. analysis➞description - Describing how an Analysis was carried out. (e.g.: computational tools, settings, etc.). analysis➞has input - The input data File entities used in the Analysis. analysis➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Analysis. analysis➞reference chromosome analysis➞reference genome analysis➞type - The type of the Analysis. Either Reference Alignment (BAM) or Sequence Variation (VCF) biospecimen➞alias - The alias for an entity. biospecimen➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0005267' indicates that the Individual suffers from 'Heart Disease'. biospecimen➞has individual - The Individual entity from which this Biospecimen was derived. biospecimen➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. biospecimen➞type - The type of Biospecimen. checksum - A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. checksum type - The type of algorithm used to generate the checksum of a file. data access committee➞alias - The alias for an entity. data access committee➞description - A description for the Data Access Committee. data access committee➞main contact - The main contact for the Data Access Committee. data access committee➞name - The name for the Data Access Committee. data access policy➞alias - The alias for an entity. data access policy➞description - A short description for the Data Access Policy. data access policy➞has data access committee - The Data Access Committee linked to this policy. data access policy➞name - A name for the Data Access Policy. data access policy➞policy text - The terms of data use and policy verbiage should be captured here. dataset➞alias - The alias for an entity. dataset➞description dataset➞has analysis - One or more Analysis entities that are referenced by this Dataset. dataset➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to this Dataset. dataset➞has experiment - One or more Experiment entities that are referenced by this Dataset. dataset➞has file - One or more File entities that collectively are part of this Dataset. dataset➞has sample - One or more Sample entities that are referenced by this Dataset. dataset➞has study - One or more Study entities that are referenced by this Dataset. dataset➞title - A title for the submitted Dataset. dataset➞type description - Description of an entity. experiment process➞has input - The input to the Experiment Process. Usually a Sample entity. experiment process➞has protocol - The Protocol entity used by this Experiment Process. experiment process➞title - A descriptive title that explains the step(s) involved in performing the experiment leading up to the sequencing of the sample and generation of raw data from the instrument. (eg: Sample extraction -> Target Enrichment) experiment process➞type - The type of experiment process. experiment➞alias - The alias for an entity. experiment➞description - A detailed description of the Experiment. experiment➞has experiment process - One or more Experiment Processes entities associated with this Experiment. experiment➞has file - One or more Files entities that are generated as output of this Experiment. experiment➞has protocol - One or more Protocol entities associated with this Experiment. experiment➞has sample - The Sample entity associated with this Experiment. experiment➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Experiment. experiment➞title - Name for the experiment (eg: GHGAE_PBMC_RNAseq). experiment➞type - The type of Experiment. file➞alias - The alias for an entity. file➞checksum file➞checksum type file➞format file➞name - The given filename. format - The format of the file: BAM, SAM, CRAM, BAI, etc. has analysis - The analysis associated with an entity. has data access committee - Data Access Committee associated with an entity. has data access policy - Data Access Policy associated with an entity. has disease - Disease concept that the entity is associated with. has experiment - The experiment associated with an entity. has experiment process has file - The file associated with an entity. has individual - The subject/individual associated with an entity. has input - The input to a Planned Process. has phenotypic feature - Phenotypic feature concept that the entity is associated with. has protocol - The protocol associated with an entity. has sample - The sample associated with an entity. has study - The study associated with an entity. id - An identifier that uniquely represents an entity. individual➞age individual➞alias - The alias for an entity. individual➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. individual➞has file - Additional/supplementary files associated with an Individual. Typically, a phenopacket or pedigree file. individual➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. individual➞sex individual➞vital status - Last known Vital Status of an Individual. instrument model - The name and model of the technology platform used to perform sequencing. library layout - Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode library name - A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. library preparation - The general method for sequencing library preparation (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). library preparation protocol➞alias library preparation protocol➞description - Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). library preparation protocol➞library layout library preparation protocol➞library name library preparation protocol➞library preparation library preparation protocol➞library selection library preparation protocol➞library type library selection - Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) library type - Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) main contact - The person who is the main contact for a committee. name - The name for an entity. named thing➞alias - The alias (alternate identifier) for an entity. named thing➞id - The internal unique identifier for an entity. ontology class mixin➞description - The description or definition of an ontology class. ontology class mixin➞name - The name or label (rdfs:label) of an ontology class. policy text - The complete text for the Data Access Policy. project➞alias - The alias for an entity. project➞description - Short textual description of the project. project➞title - Comprehensive title for the project. protocol➞alias - The alias for an entity. protocol➞description - Detailed description of the Protocol. protocol➞has file - A document that describes the Protocol. protocol➞name - Name of the protocol (eg: Sample extraction_PCR amplification). protocol➞type - Type of the protocol (eg: Target enrichment). publication➞alias - The alias for an entity. publication➞id - An identifier that uniquely represents an entity. publication➞title - The title for the Publication. reference chromosome - The reference chromosome used for this Analysis. reference genome - A published genetic sequence that is used as a reference sequence against which other sequences are compared. Reference genome(s) or annotation(s) used for prior analyses (eg: GRCh38.p13). sample➞alias - The alias for an entity. sample➞description - Short textual description of the sample (How the sample was collected, sample source, protocol followed for processing the sample etc). sample➞has individual - The Individual from which this Sample was derived from. sample➞name - Name of the sample (eg:GHGAS_Blood_Sample1 or GHGAS_PBMC_RNAseq_S1). sample➞type - The type of sample. sequencing protocol➞alias sequencing protocol➞description - Description about the sequencing protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sequencing protocol➞instrument model sequencing protocol➞type - Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sex - The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. study➞affiliation study➞alias - The alias for an entity. study➞description - A detailed description (abstract) that describes the goals of this Study. study➞has file - Additional/supplementary files associated with a Study. study➞title - A comprehensive title for the study. study➞type - The type of Study. For example, 'Cancer Genomics', 'Epigenetics', 'Exome Sequencing'. submission➞affiliation - Institution/Center/Data Hub that is providing this submission. submission➞has analysis - Information about one or more Analysis entities associated with this submission. submission➞has data access committee - The Data Access Committee that applies to Dataset in this submission. submission➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to Dataset in this submission. submission➞has experiment - Information about one or more Experiment entities associated with this submission. submission➞has file - Information about one or more File entities associated with this submission. submission➞has individual - Information about one or more Individual entities associated with this submission. submission➞has protocol - One or more Protocol entities associated with this Submission. submission➞has sample - Information about one or more Sample entities associated with this submission. submission➞has study - Information about a Study entities associated with this submission. submission➞id - A internal unique identifier for the Submission. target regions - Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. tissue - An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function. title - The title that describes an entity. type - The type of an entity. vital status - The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown. workflow➞alias - The alias for an entity. workflow➞name Types ¶ Enums ¶

docs.text: Class: experiment ¶ An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. URI: GHGA:Experiment Parents ¶ is_a: Investigation - Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. Uses Mixin ¶ mixin: AttributeMixin - Mixin for entities that can have one or more attributes. mixin: AccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned a GHGA accession. mixin: EgaAccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned an EGA accession, in addition to GHGA accession. Referenced by Class ¶ Dataset dataset➞has experiment 0..* Experiment None has experiment 0..1 Experiment Submission submission➞has experiment 0..* Experiment Attributes ¶ Own ¶ experiment➞type 0..1 Description: The type of Experiment. Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) biological replicates 0..1 Description: A biological replicate is a replicate role that consists of independent biological replicates made from different individual biosamples. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) technical replicates 0..1 Description: A technical replicate is a replicate role where the same BioSample is use e.g. the same pool of RNA used to assess technical (as opposed to biological) variation within an experiment. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) experiment➞title 0..1 Description: Name for the experiment (eg: GHGAE_PBMC_RNAseq). docs.text: Class: experiment process ¶ An Experiment Process is a process that describes how a Sample is transformed to a File via an assay. The Experiment Process also keeps track of the Protocol used and the Agent that is running the experiment. URI: GHGA:ExperimentProcess Parents ¶ is_a: PlannedProcess - A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. docs.text: Class: individual ¶ An Individual is a Person who is participating in a Study. URI: GHGA:Individual Parents ¶ is_a: Person - A member of the species Homo sapiens. Uses Mixin ¶ mixin: AccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned a GHGA accession. mixin: EgaAccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned an EGA accession, in addition to GHGA accession. Children ¶ Donor - A Donor is an Individual that participates in a research Study by donating a Biospecimen. The use of the Biospecimen is restricted to the consent provided by the Donor. Referenced by Class ¶ Biospecimen biospecimen➞has individual 0..1 Individual Cohort cohort➞has member 0..* Individual Family family➞has member 0..* Individual Family family➞has proband 0..1 Individual None has individual 0..1 Individual None has proband 0..1 Individual Individual individual➞has children 0..* Individual Individual individual➞has parent 0..* Individual Sample sample➞has individual 0..1 Individual Submission submission➞has individual 0..* Individual Submission submission➞has member 0..* Individual Attributes ¶ Own ¶ individual➞sex 1..1 Description: The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. Range: biological sex enum in subsets: (essential,restricted) karyotype 0..1 Description: The karyotype of an individual if defined. Range: String in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞age 1..1 Description: Age of an individual. Range: age range enum in subsets: (essential,restricted) individual➞vital status 1..1 Description: Last known Vital Status of an Individual. Range: vital status enum in subsets: (essential,restricted) geographical region 0..1 Description: The geographical region where the Individual is located. Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries. Range: String in subsets: (optional,restricted) has ancestry 0..* Description: A person's descent or lineage, from a person or from a population. Typically this is a value from HANCESTRO (Human Ancestry Ontology). Range: Ancestry in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞has parent 0..* Description: One or more parent for this Individual. Range: Individual in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞has children 0..* Description: One or more children for this Individual. Range: Individual in subsets: (optional,restricted) individual➞has disease 0..* Description: The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. Range: Disease in subsets: (essential,public) individual➞has phenotypic feature 0..* Description: The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. docs.text: Class: information content entity ¶ A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing. URI: GHGA:InformationContentEntity Parents ¶ is_a: NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Children ¶ DataAccessPolicy - A Data Access Policy specifies under which circumstances, legal or otherwise, a user can have access to one or more Datasets belonging to one or more Studies. DataUseCondition - Data Use Condition represents the use conditions associated with a policy. DataUseModifier - Data use modifiers indicate additional conditions for use. DataUsePermission - A data item that is used to indicate consent permissions for datasets and/or materials and relates to the purposes for which datasets and/or material might be removed, stored or used. Dataset - A Dataset is a collection of Files that is prepared for distribution and is tied to a Data Access Policy. File - A file is an object that contains information generated from a process, either an Experiment or an Analysis. Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Publication - The Publication entity represents a publication. While a publication can be any article that is published, the minimum expectation is that the publication has a valid DOI. Technology - A Technology is an abstraction that represents the instrument used for an assay. The Technology entity captures instrument-specific attributes that are relevant for an Experiment entity. The Technology entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular technology. Workflow - A Workflow is an abstraction that represents the workflow used to perform an analysis. The Workflow entity captures workflow-specific attributes that are relevant for an Analysis entity. The Workflow entity may be further characterized by its children where each child has fields that are relevant to that particular workflow. WorkflowStep - A Workflow Step represents each individual step performed in a Workflow. If the Workflow is a single-step workflow then the Workflow has just one Workflow Step entity. If the Workflow is a multi-step workflow then the Workflow has a Workflow Step entity for each step. All Workflow step specific attributes like parameters, and metadata about execution environment are captured by the Workflow Step entity. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Inherited from named thing: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞alias 0..1 Description: The alias (alternate identifier) for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞xref 0..* Description: Holds one or more database cross references for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String Other properties ¶ Exact Mappings: IAO:0000030

docs.text: Class: investigation ¶ Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. URI: GHGA:Investigation Parents ¶ is_a: PlannedProcess - A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. Children ¶ Experiment - An experiment is an investigation that consists of a coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data with the goal of verifying, falsifying, or establishing the validity of a hypothesis. Study - Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied. docs.text: Class: library preparation protocol ¶ Information about the library preparation of an Experiment. URI: GHGA:LibraryPreparationProtocol Parents ¶ is_a: Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Own ¶ library preparation protocol➞library name 1..1 Description: A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) library preparation protocol➞library layout 1..1 Description: Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) library preparation protocol➞library type 1..1 Description: Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) library preparation protocol➞library selection 1..1 Description: Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) library preparation protocol➞library preparation 1..1 Description: The general method for sequencing library preparation (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) library preparation protocol➞library preparation kit retail name 1..1 Description: A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) library preparation protocol➞library preparation kit manufacturer 1..1 Description: Manufacturer of library preparation kit Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) primer 0..1 Description: The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) end bias 0..1 Description: The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) target regions 0..1 Description: Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) rnaseq strandedness 0..1 Description: The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) library preparation protocol➞alias 1..1 Description: The alias for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) library preparation protocol➞description 1..1 Description: Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) library preparation protocol➞has attribute 0..* Description: One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. Range: Attribute in subsets: (optional,restricted) Inherited from protocol: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String protocol➞name 0..1 Description: Name of the protocol (eg: Sample extraction_PCR amplification). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) protocol➞type 0..1 Description: Type of the protocol (eg: Target enrichment). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) protocol➞url 0..1 Description: URL for the resource that describes this Protocol. Range: String protocol➞has file 0..1 Description: A document that describes the Protocol. Range: File in subsets: (essential,restricted) protocol➞xref 0..* Description: One or more cross-references for this Protocol. (Eg: manufacturer protocol, protocol from publication etc ) Range: String in subsets: (optional,public)

docs.text: Class: material entity ¶ A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass. URI: GHGA:MaterialEntity Parents ¶ is_a: NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Children ¶ AnatomicalEntity - Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species. Biospecimen - A Biospecimen is any natural material taken from a biological entity (usually a human) for testing, diagnostics, treatment, or research purposes. The Biospecimen is linked to the Individual from which the Biospecimen is derived. CellLine - A cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history. Population - A population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area. Sample - A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Inherited from named thing: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String Other properties ¶ Exact Mappings: SIO:000004

docs.text: Class: ontology class mixin ¶ Mixin for entities that represent an class/term/concept from an ontology. URI: GHGA:OntologyClassMixin Mixin for ¶ AnatomicalEntity (mixin) - Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species. Ancestry (mixin) - Population category defined using ancestry informative markers (AIMs) based on genetic/genomic data. DataUseModifier (mixin) - Data use modifiers indicate additional conditions for use. DataUsePermission (mixin) - A data item that is used to indicate consent permissions for datasets and/or materials and relates to the purposes for which datasets and/or material might be removed, stored or used. DiseaseOrPhenotypicFeature (mixin) - Disease or Phenotypic Feature that the entity is associated with. This entity is a union of Disease and Phenotypic Feature and exists to accommodate situations where Disease concepts are used interchangeably with Phenotype concepts or vice-versa. Range: String ontology class mixin➞description 0..1 Description: The description or definition of an ontology class. Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) ontology name 0..1 Description: The name of the ontology from which this ontology class was chosen. docs.text: Subset: optional ¶ Subset of properties that are considered to be optional. URI: GHGA:optional Classes ¶ Mixins ¶ Slots ¶ abstract - The study abstract that describes the goals. Can also hold abstract from a publication related to this study analysis process➞has agent - The Agent - a software, institution, or human - that is executing or responsible for executing the workflow. analysis process➞has output - The output data File entities generated by the Analysis Process. analysis➞has output - The output data File entities generated by this Analysis. biological replicates - A biological replicate is a replicate role that consists of independent biological replicates made from different individual biosamples. dataset➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Dataset. experiment process➞has agent - The Agent - a software, institution, or human - that is executing or responsible for executing the Experiment Process. experiment process➞has output - The output of this Experiment Process. Usually a File entity. experimental replicates - The replicate number of the assay, i.e. the numeric iteration for the assay that was repeated. geographical region - The geographical region where the Individual is located. Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries. has agent - A person or an entity that is performing a Planned Process entity. has ancestry - A person's descent or lineage, from a person or from a population. Typically this is a value from HANCESTRO (Human Ancestry Ontology). has attribute - Key/value pairs corresponding to an entity. has biospecimen - The biospecimen associated with an entity. has children - The children of an entity. has output - The output of a Planned Process entity. has parent - The parent of an entity. has project - The project associated with an entity. has publication - The Publication associated with an entity. individual➞has children - One or more children for this Individual. individual➞has parent - One or more parent for this Individual. karyotype - The karyotype of an individual if defined. library preparation protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. named thing➞xref - Holds one or more database cross references for an entity. project➞has attribute - Custom attributes for the Project (eg: Cancer - Colon cancer, prostrate cancer, blood cancer etc) project➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Project. protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Protocol. protocol➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Protocol. (Eg: manufacturer protocol, protocol from publication etc ) publication➞abstract - The study abstract that describes the goals. Can also hold abstract from a publication related to this study. publication➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Publication. sample➞has biospecimen - The Biospecimen from which this Sample was prepared from. sample➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Sample. For example, this Sample may have an EBI BioSamples accession or an EGA Sample accession. sequencing protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Sequencing Protocol. study➞has attribute - Custom key/value pairs that further characterizes the Study. (e.g.: approaches - single-cell, bulk etc) study➞has project - The project associated with this Study. study➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Study. submission➞has biospecimen - Information about one or more Biospecimen entities associated with this submission. submission➞has project - Information about a Project entity associated with this submission. submission➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Submission. technical replicates - A technical replicate is a replicate role where the same BioSample is use e.g. the same pool of RNA used to assess technical (as opposed to biological) variation within an experiment. xref - Database cross references for an entity. Types ¶ Enums ¶

docs.text: Class: planned process ¶ A process is an entity that exists in time by occurring or happening, has temporal parts and always involves and depends on some entity during the time it occurs. URI: GHGA:PlannedProcess Parents ¶ is_a: NamedThing - A databased entity, concept or class. This is a generic class that is the root of all the other classes. Children ¶ AnalysisProcess - An analysis process is a process that describes how one or more Files, from a Study, are transformed to another set of Files via a Workflow. The analysis process also keeps track of the workflow metadata and the Agent that is running the Analysis. DataTransformation - A data transformation technique used to analyze and interpret data to gain a better understanding of it. ExperimentProcess - An Experiment Process is a process that describes how a Sample is transformed to a File via an assay. The Experiment Process also keeps track of the Protocol used and the Agent that is running the experiment. Investigation - Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. ResearchActivity - A planned process executed in the performance of scientific research wherein systematic investigations are performed to establish facts and reach new conclusions about phenomena in the world. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Inherited from named thing: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞alias 0..1 Description: The alias (alternate identifier) for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞xref 0..* Description: Holds one or more database cross references for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String Other properties ¶ Exact Mappings: EFO:0004542 OBI:0000011 COB:0000082

docs.text: Class: population ¶ A population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area. docs.text: Subset: public ¶ Subset of properties that are considered to be public. URI: GHGA:public Classes ¶ Mixins ¶ Slots ¶ abstract - The study abstract that describes the goals. Can also hold abstract from a publication related to this study affiliation - The Institution(s) associated with an entity. analysis➞description - Describing how an Analysis was carried out. (e.g.: computational tools, settings, etc.). analysis➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Analysis. analysis➞reference chromosome analysis➞reference genome analysis➞type - The type of the Analysis. Either Reference Alignment (BAM) or Sequence Variation (VCF) biological replicates - A biological replicate is a replicate role that consists of independent biological replicates made from different individual biosamples. biospecimen➞has anatomical entity - The Anatomical entity, that represents the site, from which the Biospecimen was retrieved. Typically, a concept from Uber-anatomy Ontology (UBERON). For example, 'UBERON:0008307' indicates that the Biospecimen was extracted from the 'Heart Endothelium' of an Individual. biospecimen➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with the Individual. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0005267' indicates that the Individual suffers from 'Heart Disease'. biospecimen➞type - The type of Biospecimen. case control status - Whether the sample is to be treated as Case or Control in a Study. cell barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. (Eg. '0'). cell barcode read - The type of read that contains the cell barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). cell barcode size - The size of the cell identifying barcode (E.g. '16'). checksum - A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. checksum type - The type of algorithm used to generate the checksum of a file. data access committee➞description - A description for the Data Access Committee. data access committee➞name - The name for the Data Access Committee. data access policy➞description - A short description for the Data Access Policy. data access policy➞name - A name for the Data Access Policy. dataset➞description dataset➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Dataset. dataset➞has study - One or more Study entities that are referenced by this Dataset. dataset➞title - A title for the submitted Dataset. dataset➞type description - Description of an entity. end bias - The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. experiment process➞title - A descriptive title that explains the step(s) involved in performing the experiment leading up to the sequencing of the sample and generation of raw data from the instrument. (eg: Sample extraction -> Target Enrichment) experiment process➞type - The type of experiment process. experiment➞description - A detailed description of the Experiment. experiment➞has study - The Study entity associated with this Experiment. experiment➞title - Name for the experiment (eg: GHGAE_PBMC_RNAseq). experiment➞type - The type of Experiment. experimental replicates - The replicate number of the assay, i.e. the numeric iteration for the assay that was repeated. file➞checksum file➞checksum type file➞format file➞name - The given filename. flow cell id - Flow Cell ID (eg: Experiment ID_Cell 1_Lane_1). The barcode assigned to a flow cell used in nucleotide sequencing. flow cell type - Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell. format - The format of the file: BAM, SAM, CRAM, BAI, etc. has anatomical entity - Anatomical site associated with an entity. has disease - Disease concept that the entity is associated with. has project - The project associated with an entity. has publication - The Publication associated with an entity. has study - The study associated with an entity. index sequence - A unique nucleotide sequence that is added to a sample during library preparation to serve as a unique identifier for the sample. individual➞has disease - The Disease entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Mondo Disease Ontology. For example, 'MONDO:0003742' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - suffers from 'Heart Fibrosarcoma'. instrument model - The name and model of the technology platform used to perform sequencing. isolation - Method or device employed for collecting/isolating a biospecimen or a sample. lane number - The numerical identifier for the lane or machine unit where a sample was located during nucleotide sequencing. library layout - Describe whether the library was sequenced in single-end (forward or reverse) or paired-end mode library name - A short name identifying the library to potential users. The same name may refer to multiple versions of the same continually updated library. library preparation - The general method for sequencing library preparation (e.g. KAPA PCR-free). library preparation kit manufacturer - Manufacturer of library preparation kit library preparation kit retail name - A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) library preparation protocol➞description - Description about how a sequencing library was prepared (eg: Library construction method). library preparation protocol➞library layout library preparation protocol➞library name library preparation protocol➞library preparation library preparation protocol➞library preparation kit manufacturer library preparation protocol➞library preparation kit retail name library preparation protocol➞library selection library preparation protocol➞library type library selection - Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. Library Selection method (e.g. random, PCA, cDNA, etc ) library type - Describe the level of omics analysis (eg: Metagenome, transcriptome, etc) name - The name for an entity. named thing➞xref - Holds one or more database cross references for an entity. ontology class mixin➞description - The description or definition of an ontology class. ontology class mixin➞name - The name or label (rdfs:label) of an ontology class. paired or single end - Denotes whether a submitted FASTQ file contains forward (R1) or reverse (R2) reads for paired-end sequencing. The number that identifies each read direction in a paired-end nucleotide sequencing replications. primer - The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. project➞description - Short textual description of the project. project➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Project. project➞title - Comprehensive title for the project. protocol➞description - Detailed description of the Protocol. protocol➞name - Name of the protocol (eg: Sample extraction_PCR amplification). protocol➞type - Type of the protocol (eg: Target enrichment). protocol➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Protocol. (Eg: manufacturer protocol, protocol from publication etc ) publication➞abstract - The study abstract that describes the goals. Can also hold abstract from a publication related to this study. publication➞title - The title for the Publication. publication➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Publication. reference chromosome - The reference chromosome used for this Analysis. reference genome - A published genetic sequence that is used as a reference sequence against which other sequences are compared. Reference genome(s) or annotation(s) used for prior analyses (eg: GRCh38.p13). rnaseq strandedness - The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. sample barcode read - The type of read that contains the sample barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). sample➞description - Short textual description of the sample (How the sample was collected, sample source, protocol followed for processing the sample etc). sample➞has anatomical entity sample➞name - Name of the sample (eg:GHGAS_Blood_Sample1 or GHGAS_PBMC_RNAseq_S1). sample➞type - The type of sample. sample➞xref - One or more cross-references for this Sample. For example, this Sample may have an EBI BioSamples accession or an EGA Sample accession. sequencing center - Center where sample was sequenced. sequencing protocol➞description - Description about the sequencing protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). sequencing protocol➞instrument model sequencing protocol➞type - Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). storage - Methods by which a biospecimen or a sample is stored (e.g. frozen in liquid nitrogen). study➞affiliation study➞description - A detailed description (abstract) that describes the goals of this Study. study➞has project - The project associated with this Study. study➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Study. study➞title - A comprehensive title for the study. study➞type - The type of Study. For example, 'Cancer Genomics', 'Epigenetics', 'Exome Sequencing'. submission➞affiliation - Institution/Center/Data Hub that is providing this submission. submission➞has project - Information about a Project entity associated with this submission. submission➞has publication - One or more Publication entities associated with this Submission. submission➞has study - Information about a Study entities associated with this submission. target regions - Subset of genes or specific regions of the genome, which are most likely to be involved in the phenotype under study. technical replicates - A technical replicate is a replicate role where the same BioSample is use e.g. the same pool of RNA used to assess technical (as opposed to biological) variation within an experiment. tissue - An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function. title - The title that describes an entity. type - The type of an entity. umi barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. (E.g. '16'). umi barcode read - The type of read that contains the UMI barcode (Eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). umi barcode size - The size of the UMI identifying barcode (Eg. '10'). vital status at sampling - Vital Status of an Individual at the point of sampling (eg:'Alive', 'Deceased'). workflow➞name xref - Database cross references for an entity. Types ¶ Enums ¶

(Eg. '0'). cell barcode read - The type of read that contains the cell barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). cell barcode size - The size of the cell identifying barcode (E.g. '16'). data access policy➞has data use condition - Data Use Condition entities that are associated with the Data Access Policy. data access policy➞policy url - URL for the policy, if available. This is useful if the terms of the policy is made available online at a resolvable URL. data use condition➞has data use modifier - Modifier for Data use permission associated with a policy. Should be descendants of 'DUO:0000017 data use modifier' data use condition➞has data use permission - Data use permission associated with a policy. Typically one or more terms from DUO and should be descendants of 'DUO:0000001 data use permission'. end bias - The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. flow cell id - Flow Cell ID (eg: Experiment ID_Cell 1_Lane_1). The barcode assigned to a flow cell used in nucleotide sequencing. flow cell type - Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell. has anatomical entity - Anatomical site associated with an entity. has data use condition - Data Use Condition entities that are associated with an entity. has data use modifier - Modifier for Data use permission associated with an entity. Should be descendants of 'DUO:0000017 data use modifier' has data use permission - Data use permission associated with an entity. Typically one or more terms from DUO. Should be descendants of 'DUO:0000001 data use permission'. index sequence - A unique nucleotide sequence that is added to a sample during library preparation to serve as a unique identifier for the sample. isolation - Method or device employed for collecting/isolating a biospecimen or a sample. lane number - The numerical identifier for the lane or machine unit where a sample was located during nucleotide sequencing. library preparation kit manufacturer - Manufacturer of library preparation kit library preparation kit retail name - A unique identifier for the kit used to construct a genomic library. This may include the vendor name, kit name and kit version (e.g. Agilent sure select Human Exome V8, Twist RefSeq Exome, etc.) library preparation protocol➞library preparation kit manufacturer library preparation protocol➞library preparation kit retail name paired or single end - Denotes whether a submitted FASTQ file contains forward (R1) or reverse (R2) reads for paired-end sequencing. The number that identifies each read direction in a paired-end nucleotide sequencing replications. policy url - Alternative to pasting the Data Access Policy text. primer - The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. rnaseq strandedness - The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. sample barcode read - The type of read that contains the sample barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). sample➞has anatomical entity sequencing center - Center where sample was sequenced. storage - Methods by which a biospecimen or a sample is stored (e.g. frozen in liquid nitrogen). umi barcode offset - The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. (E.g. '16'). umi barcode read - The type of read that contains the UMI barcode (Eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). umi barcode size - The size of the UMI identifying barcode (Eg. '10'). vital status at sampling - Vital Status of an Individual at the point of sampling (eg:'Alive', 'Deceased').

Typically, a phenopacket or pedigree file. individual➞has parent - One or more parent for this Individual. individual➞has phenotypic feature - The Phenotypic Feature entity that is associated with this Biospecimen at the time of retrieval from the organism. Typically, a concept from Human Phenotype Ontology. For example, 'HP:0100244' indicates that the Individual - from which the Biospecimen was extracted from - exhibits 'Fibrosarcoma' as one of its phenotype. individual➞sex individual➞vital status - Last known Vital Status of an Individual. karyotype - The karyotype of an individual if defined. library preparation protocol➞alias library preparation protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Library Preparation Protocol. main contact - The person who is the main contact for a committee. named thing➞alias - The alias (alternate identifier) for an entity. named thing➞id - The internal unique identifier for an entity. policy text - The complete text for the Data Access Policy. policy url - Alternative to pasting the Data Access Policy text. project➞alias - The alias for an entity. project➞has attribute - Custom attributes for the Project (eg: Cancer - Colon cancer, prostrate cancer, blood cancer etc) protocol➞alias - The alias for an entity. protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Protocol. protocol➞has file - A document that describes the Protocol. publication➞alias - The alias for an entity. publication➞id - An identifier that uniquely represents an entity. sample➞alias - The alias for an entity. sample➞has biospecimen - The Biospecimen from which this Sample was prepared from. sample➞has individual - The Individual from which this Sample was derived from. sequencing protocol➞alias sequencing protocol➞has attribute - One or more attributes that further characterizes this Sequencing Protocol. sex - The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female. study➞alias - The alias for an entity. study➞has attribute - Custom key/value pairs that further characterizes the Study. (e.g.: approaches - single-cell, bulk etc) study➞has file - Additional/supplementary files associated with a Study. submission➞has analysis - Information about one or more Analysis entities associated with this submission. submission➞has biospecimen - Information about one or more Biospecimen entities associated with this submission. submission➞has data access committee - The Data Access Committee that applies to Dataset in this submission. submission➞has data access policy - The Data Access Policy that applies to Dataset in this submission. submission➞has experiment - Information about one or more Experiment entities associated with this submission. submission➞has file - Information about one or more File entities associated with this submission. submission➞has individual - Information about one or more Individual entities associated with this submission. submission➞has protocol - One or more Protocol entities associated with this Submission. submission➞has sample - Information about one or more Sample entities associated with this submission. submission➞id - A internal unique identifier for the Submission. vital status - The state or condition of being living or deceased; also includes the case where the vital status is unknown. workflow➞alias - The alias for an entity. docs.text: Class: sample ¶ A sample is a limited quantity of something to be used for testing, analysis, inspection, investigation, demonstration, or trial use. A sample is prepared from a Biospecimen (isolate or tissue). URI: GHGA:Sample Parents ¶ is_a: MaterialEntity - A material entity is a physical entity that is spatially extended, exists as a whole at any point in time and has mass. Uses Mixin ¶ mixin: AccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned a GHGA accession. mixin: EgaAccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned an EGA accession, in addition to GHGA accession. mixin: AttributeMixin - Mixin for entities that can have one or more attributes. Referenced by Class ¶ Dataset dataset➞has sample 1..* Sample ExperimentProcess experiment process➞has input 0..1 Sample Experiment experiment➞has sample 1..* Sample None has sample 0..1 Sample Submission submission➞has sample 0..* Sample Attributes ¶ Own ¶ sample➞name 1..1 Description: Name of the sample (eg:GHGAS_Blood_Sample1 or GHGAS_PBMC_RNAseq_S1). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) sample➞type 0..1 Description: The type of sample. Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) sample➞description 1..1 Description: Short textual description of the sample (How the sample was collected, sample source, protocol followed for processing the sample etc). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) case control status 0..1 Description: Whether the sample is to be treated as Case or Control in a Study. Range: case control status enum in subsets: (recommended,public) vital status at sampling 0..1 Description: Vital Status of an Individual at the point of sampling (eg:'Alive', 'Deceased'). Range: vital status enum in subsets: (recommended,public) isolation 0..1 Description: Method or device employed for collecting/isolating a biospecimen or a sample. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) storage 0..1 Description: Methods by which a biospecimen or a sample is stored (e.g. frozen in liquid nitrogen). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) sample➞has individual 0..1 Description: The Individual from which this Sample was derived from. Range: Individual in subsets: (essential,restricted) sample➞has anatomical entity 0..* Description: Anatomical site associated with an entity. Range: AnatomicalEntity in subsets: (recommended,public) sample➞has biospecimen 0..1 Description: The Biospecimen from which this Sample was prepared from. Range: Biospecimen in subsets: (optional,restricted) sample➞alias 1..1 Description: The alias for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) sample➞xref 0..* Description: One or more cross-references for this Sample. For example, this Sample may have an EBI BioSamples accession or an EGA Sample accession. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) Inherited from material entity: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. docs.text: Class: sequencing protocol ¶ Information about the sequencing of a sample. URI: GHGA:SequencingProtocol Parents ¶ is_a: Protocol - A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process. Referenced by Class ¶ Attributes ¶ Own ¶ sequencing center 0..1 Description: Center where sample was sequenced. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) sequencing protocol➞instrument model 1..1 Description: The name and model of the technology platform used to perform sequencing. Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) paired or single end 0..1 Description: Denotes whether a submitted FASTQ file contains forward (R1) or reverse (R2) reads for paired-end sequencing. The number that identifies each read direction in a paired-end nucleotide sequencing replications. Range: paired or single end enum in subsets: (recommended,public) sequencing read length 0..1 Description: Length of sequencing reads (eg: Long or short or actual number of the read length etc). The number of nucleotides successfully ordered from each side of a nucleic acid fragment obtained after the completion of a sequencing process Range: String index sequence 0..1 Description: A unique nucleotide sequence that is added to a sample during library preparation to serve as a unique identifier for the sample. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) target coverage 0..1 Description: Mean coverage for whole genome sequencing, or mean target coverage for whole exome and targeted sequencing. The number of times a particular locus (site, nucleotide, amplicon, region) was sequenced. Range: String lane number 0..1 Description: The numerical identifier for the lane or machine unit where a sample was located during nucleotide sequencing. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) flow cell id 0..1 Description: Flow Cell ID (eg: Experiment ID_Cell 1_Lane_1). The barcode assigned to a flow cell used in nucleotide sequencing. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) flow cell type 0..1 Description: Type of flow cell used (e.g. S4, S2 for NovaSeq; PromethION, Flongle for Nanopore). Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell. Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) umi barcode read 0..1 Description: The type of read that contains the UMI barcode (Eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) umi barcode size 0..1 Description: The size of the UMI identifying barcode (Eg. '10'). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) umi barcode offset 0..1 Description: The offset in sequence of the UMI identifying barcode. (E.g. '16'). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) cell barcode read 0..1 Description: The type of read that contains the cell barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) cell barcode offset 0..1 Description: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. (Eg. '0'). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) cell barcode size 0..1 Description: The size of the cell identifying barcode (E.g. '16'). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) sample barcode read 0..1 Description: The type of read that contains the sample barcode (eg: index1/index2/read1/read2). Range: String in subsets: (recommended,public) sequencing protocol➞alias 1..1 Description: The alias for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) sequencing protocol➞type 0..1 Description: Name of the library preparation protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) sequencing protocol➞description 1..1 Description: Description about the sequencing protocol (eg: mRNA-seq,Whole exome long-read sequencing etc). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) sequencing protocol➞has attribute 0..* Description: One or more attributes that further characterizes this Sequencing Protocol. Range: Attribute in subsets: (optional,restricted) Inherited from protocol: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String protocol➞name 0..1 Description: Name of the protocol (eg: Sample extraction_PCR amplification). Range: String in subsets: (essential,public) protocol➞url 0..1 Description: URL for the resource that describes this Protocol. Range: String protocol➞has file 0..1 Description: A document that describes the Protocol. Range: File in subsets: (essential,restricted) protocol➞xref 0..* Description: One or more cross-references for this Protocol. (Eg: manufacturer protocol, protocol from publication etc ) Range: String in subsets: (optional,public)

docs.text: Class: study ¶ Studies are experimental investigations of a particular phenomenon. It involves a detailed examination and analysis of a subject to learn more about the phenomenon being studied. URI: GHGA:Study Parents ¶ is_a: Investigation - Investigation is the process of carrying out a plan or procedure so as to discover fact or information about the object of study. Uses Mixin ¶ mixin: AccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned a GHGA accession. mixin: EgaAccessionMixin - Mixin for entities that can be assigned an EGA accession, in addition to GHGA accession. mixin: PublicationMixin - Mixin for entities that can have one or more publications. mixin: AttributeMixin - Mixin for entities that can have one or more attributes. mixin: ReleaseStatusMixin - Mixin for entities that can be released at a later point in time. docs.text: Class: workflow step ¶ A Workflow Step represents each individual step performed in a Workflow. If the Workflow is a single-step workflow then the Workflow has just one Workflow Step entity. If the Workflow is a multi-step workflow then the Workflow has a Workflow Step entity for each step. All Workflow step specific attributes like parameters, and metadata about execution environment are captured by the Workflow Step entity. URI: GHGA:WorkflowStep Parents ¶ is_a: InformationContentEntity - A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing. Referenced by Class ¶ None has workflow step 0..1 WorkflowStep Workflow workflow➞has workflow step 0..* WorkflowStep Attributes ¶ Own ¶ workflow step➞has workflow parameter 0..* Description: One or more parameters that are associated with this Workflow Step. Range: WorkflowParameter Inherited from information content entity: ¶ named thing➞id 1..1 Description: The internal unique identifier for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞alias 0..1 Description: The alias (alternate identifier) for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (essential,restricted) named thing➞xref 0..* Description: Holds one or more database cross references for an entity. Range: String in subsets: (optional,public) named thing➞creation date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was created. Range: String named thing➞update date 0..1 Description: Timestamp (in ISO 8601 format) when the entity was updated. Range: String

docs.text: Slot: checksum ¶ A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. URI: GHGA:checksum Domain and Range ¶ None → 0..1 String Parents ¶ Children ¶ file➞checksum Used by ¶ Other properties ¶ In Subsets: essential public Exact Mappings: NCIT:C43522
docs.title: Slot: checksum

docs.text: Enum: experiment process type enum ¶ The different types of Experiment Processes. URI: GHGA:experiment_process_type_enum Other properties ¶ Permissible Values ¶ Text Description Meaning Other Information sample_preparation An Experiment Process that represents the transformation of a Sample in preparation for an assay. When an Experiment Process is of type 'sample preparation', both the input and output to the Experiment Process is a Sample. assay An Experiment Process that represents an assay which performs measurement on a Sample to generate data. When an Experiemnt Process is of type 'assay', the input is a Sample and the output is a File.

docs.text: Slot: checksum ¶ A computed value which depends on the contents of a block of data and which is transmitted or stored along with the data in order to detect corruption of the data. The receiving system recomputes the checksum based upon the received data and compares this value with the one sent with the data. If the two values are the same, the receiver has some confidence that the data was received correctly. URI: GHGA:file_checksum Domain and Range ¶ File → 1..1 String Parents ¶ is_a: checksum Children ¶ Used by ¶ File Other properties ¶ In Subsets: essential public Exact Mappings: NCIT:C43522
docs.title: Slot: checksum
